abstract: Episcopalians at church’s general convention in Salt Lake City overwhelmingly vote to allow religious weddings for same-sex couples, reaffirming church’s support of gay rights.
lead_paragraph: Episcopalians at the church’s general convention in Salt Lake City overwhelmingly voted on Wednesday to allow religious weddings for same-sex couples, solidifying the church’s embrace of gay rights.

headline.main: Episcopalians Change Laws on Rites for Gay Couples
headline.print_headline: Episcopalians Change Laws on Rites for Gay Couples

snippet: Episcopalians at the church’s general convention in Salt Lake City overwhelmingly voted on Wednesday to allow religious weddings for same-sex couples, solidifying the church’s embrace of gay rights.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
